page.syntax: Filter_Expression as C = random_percent_records(percent as n[,filter as c])

argument.name: Filter_Expression
argument.description: An expression that selects records from a table.

argument.name: percent
argument.description: An integer number greater than 0 and less than or equal to 100. The count of records to return.

argument.name: filter
argument.description: Optional. Default = ".T." (All records). A character filter expression that evaluates to a logical value and selects records from the table.

page.description: Return percent of the records, selected at random.
page.discussion: Selects a specified Percent of the random records from a table. If the optional filter is supplied, the records are selected only from those that satisfy the filter. Percent is expressed as a whole number, e.g. 50 for 50%. RANDOM_PERCENT_RECORDS() is a special function used only in queries to return a percent of the records,selected at random, in the currently open table. If the optional filter is supplied, the random records are selected from the records selected by the filter.

section.title: Example
section.description: See Top, Bottom, Nth Record and Random Record Queries for more information. The following query randomly selects and returns 10% percent of the table's orders placed after May 1, 2000.
section.example: dim tbl as P dim inx as P tbl = table.current() query.filter = "random_percent_records(10, \"orderdate > {5/1/2000}\")" query.order = "order_total" inx = tbl.query_create() topparent.resynch()
